SEARCH

Class OrderThomas

java.lang.Object
OrderThomas
public class OrderThomas extends Object
This class handles the ordering of menu items. You can add items to your order, you can find the least expensive item/most expensive item, have your total calculated for your order, get the count(number of items in your order) of your items, and receive a small detail printout of your order.

    myMenuItems
    myMenuItems - is an Array to store up to 8 menu items.

    mySize - the number of menu items in your order.

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Getter method - get the size (number of menu items in current order)
      Returns:

    • addToOrder

      public boolean addToOrder(MenuItemThomas item)
      addToOrder - adds menu items to your order.
      Parameters:
      item - - menu item that was added.
      Returns:
      True/False depending on whether the item was added successfully or not.

    • findMostExpensive

      public MenuItemThomas findMostExpensive()
      findMostExpensive - this method initializes the mostExpItem variable to the first item then iterates through the remainder to see if there is a more expensive item.
      Returns:
      - either null or most expensive item.

    • findLeastExpensive

      public MenuItemThomas findLeastExpensive()
      findLeastExpensive - this method initializes leastExpItem variable to the first item, then iterates through the remainder to see if there is a less expensive item exists.
      Returns:
      - null or least expensive item.

    • calcTotal

      public double calcTotal()
      calcTotal - this method initializes total to 0 then, iterates through all menu items in your order. For each menu item it multiplies price of item by its quantity and adds to total variable, then returns total.
      Returns:
      total double which is what you owe.

    • getCount

      public int getCount()
      getCount- this method initializes count to 0 then iterates through all menu items. For every item it uses getQuant to get quantity then adds it to count variable and returns count.
      Returns:
      total count of items in your order.

    • printList

      public void printList()
      printList - this method prints the details of all the items in your order. Seen at most fast food ordering screens.
